issue.title: Load and register custom TestExecutionListener implementations automatically

milestone.title: 5.0 M4
milestone.description: Themes: test templates, repeated tests, and parameterized tests.

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: ‚úÖ The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
What about adding support for loading custom `TestExecutionListener` implementations via the Service API to the console launcher?

Enhance (and document) [ExecuteTestsTask#registerListeners](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/master/junit-platform-console/src/main/java/org/junit/platform/console/tasks/ExecuteTestsTask.java#L90) with:
```java
ServiceLoader.load(TestExecutionListener.class)
  .forEach(launcher::registerTestExecutionListeners);
```

Or add the load and register functionality to the platform `DefaultLauncher` itself?

body: Good idea! I think documenting it in the Wiki is a little too far away for everyday coding, though. What about extending the pull request template (e.g. with a checkbox list)? Similarly an issue template could be created.

Great ideas, @nicolaiparlog! üëç 

I think we'll document it in the wiki for thoroughness and update our templates as well.

Cheers

First draft of DoD: https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/wiki/Definition-of-Done

@junit-team/junit-lambda Please take a look and let me know what you think. What did I miss?

I think that's a great draft. Thanks for putting it together!

The only additional things I can think of at the moment are along the lines of...

- ensure preconditions are documented and checked
- follow the defined logging guidelines
I've added both to the wiki page. Please take another look!
